article_title: Casey Mulligan: A Recovery Stymied by Redistribution
article_text:
This is adapted from remarks by University of Chicago economics professor Casey B. Mulligan on receiving the Hayek Prize on June 25 from the Manhattan Institute for his book "The Redistribution Recession":

Why has the labor market contracted so much and why does it remain depressed? Major subsidies and regulations intended to...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Casey Mulligan writes that public policy intended to make layoffs less painful actually made layoffs  cheaper and more common.
twitter.title: A Recovery Stymied by Redistribution

image.alt: Casey Mulligan: Laws and regulations intended to make layoffs less painful have made layoffs cheaper and more common.
